00041     template <class T>
00042     static inline vector<T> matrixAdd( const vector<T>& vec1, const vector<T>& vec2 )
00043     {
00044         int maxLength;
00045         vector<T> result;
00046         if( vec1.size() < vec2.size() )
00047         {
00048             maxLength = vec1.size();
00049         }
00050         else
00051         {
00052             maxLength = vec2.size();
00053         }
00054 
00055         for( int i = 0; i < maxLength; ++i )
00056         {
00057             result.push_back( vec1[i] + vec2[i] );
00058         }
00059 
00060         return result;
00061     }

00068     template <class T>
00069     static inline string matrix9ToString( const vector<T>& vec, bool printDebug = true )
00070     {
00071         if( vec.size() != 9 )
00072         {
00073             logger.print( "Warning: in print matrix, size of matrix != 9, its: " + lexical_cast<string>(vec.size()), printDebug );
00074 
00075             return "";
00076         }
00077 
00078         ostringstream ostream;
00079         for( int i = 0; i < 9; ++i )
00080         {
00081             ostream << vec[i] << " ";
00082             if( (i + 1) % 3 == 0 )
00083             {
00084                 ostream << '\n';
00085             }
00086         }
00087 
00088         return ostream.str();
00089     }

00096     template <class T>
00097     static inline vector<T> vector3RotateY( const vector<T>& vec, double degree, bool printDebug = true,
00098                                       bool doNotify = false )
00099     {
00100         degree *= (3.14/180);
00101         if( vec.size() != 3 )
00102         {
00103             if( printDebug )
00104             {
00105                 logger.print( "Warning: this function will only work on vectors of size 3 (only works in a three-dimensional manifold", printDebug );
00106                 return vec;
00107             }
00108         }
00109         vector<T> result;
00110         vector<T> rotMatrix;
00111         rotMatrix.resize(9);
00112         rotMatrix[0] = cos(degree);
00113         rotMatrix[1] = 0;
00114         rotMatrix[2] = -1 * sin( degree );
00115         rotMatrix[3] = 0;
00116         rotMatrix[4] = 1;
00117         rotMatrix[5] = 0;
00118         rotMatrix[6] = sin( degree );
00119         rotMatrix[7] = 0;
00120         rotMatrix[8] = cos( degree );
00121 
00122         logger.print( "Notify: rotationMatrix \n " + matrix9ToString( rotMatrix ) , printDebug && doNotify );
00123 
00124         return vector3MultMatrix( vec, rotMatrix, printDebug );
00125     }

00139     template <class T>
00140     static inline vector<T> vector3Rotate( const vector<T>& vec, const vector<T>& rotateAxis, double degree, bool printDebug = true, bool doNotify = false )
00141     {
00142         if( vec.size() != 3 || rotateAxis.size() != 3 )
00143         {
00144             logger.print( "Warning: this function will only work on vectors in a three dimensional manifold (the vector size & rotation axis size must be 3)", printDebug );
00145             return vec;
00146         }
00147 
00148         degree *= (3.14/180);
00149         vector<T> result;
00150         vector<T> rotMatrix;
00151         double u = rotateAxis[0];
00152         double u2 = u*u;
00153         double v = rotateAxis[1];
00154         double v2 = v*v;
00155         double w = rotateAxis[2];
00156         double w2 = w*w;
00157         double L = sqrt( u * u + v * v + w * w );
00158         double L2 = L*L;
00159         double sine = sin( degree );
00160         double cosine = cos( degree );
00161 
00162         //This test appears to work?
00163         //If this starts failing, use -ffloat-store, and put 0.0 into a variable
00164         //(see g++ man page)
00165         if( L2 == 0.0 )
00166         {
00167             logger.print( "Warning the magnitude of the rotation axis was zero, (the vector being rotated is parallel to the rotation axis)", printDebug );
00168             return vec;
00169         }
00170 
00171         rotMatrix.resize(9);
00172         rotMatrix[0] = (u2 + (v2 + w2) * cosine) / L2;
00173         rotMatrix[1] = (u * v * (1 - cosine) - w * L * sine) / L2;
00174         rotMatrix[2] = (u * w * (1 - cosine) + v * L * sine) / L2;
00175 
00176         rotMatrix[3] = (u * v * (1 - cosine) + w * L * sine) / L2;
00177         rotMatrix[4] = (v2 + (u2 + w2) * cosine) / L2;
00178         rotMatrix[5] = (v * w * (1 - cosine) - u * L * sine) / L2;
00179 
00180         rotMatrix[6] = (u * w * (1 - cosine) - v * L * sine) / L2;
00181         rotMatrix[7] = (v * w * (1 - cosine) + u * L * sine) / L2;
00182         rotMatrix[8] = (w2 + (u2 + v2) * cosine) / L2;
00183 
00184         logger.print( "Notify: rotation matrix is: \n" + matrix9ToString( rotMatrix ), printDebug && doNotify );
00185 
00186         return vector3MultMatrix( vec, rotMatrix, printDebug );
00187     }

00196     template <class T>
00197     static inline vector<T> vectorCrossProduct( const vector<T>& vec1, const vector<T>& vec2, bool printDebug = true, bool doNotify = false )
00198     {
00199         logger.print( "Notify: entered vectorDotProduct", printDebug && doNotify );
00200         vector<T> result;
00201         if( vec1.size() != 3 || vec2.size() != 3 )
00202         {
00203             logger.print( "Warning: vectorDotProdcut takes two vectors of size 3 (only works in a 3-manifold), one of the vectors was not 3", printDebug );
00204 
00205             T defaultValue;
00206             Utility::setDefaultValue( defaultValue );
00207             result.push_back( defaultValue );
00208             result.push_back( defaultValue );
00209             result.push_back( defaultValue );
00210             return result;
00211         }
00212 
00213         //x
00214         result.push_back( vec1[1] * vec2[2] - vec1[2] * vec2[1] );
00215         //y
00216         result.push_back( vec1[0] * vec2[2] - vec1[2] * vec2[0] );
00217         //z
00218         result.push_back( vec1[0] * vec2[1] - vec1[1] * vec2[0] );
00219 
00220         return result;
00221     }

00253     template <class T>
00254     static inline vector<T> getNormal( const vector<T>& p1, const vector<T>& p2, const vector<T>& p3, bool printDebug = true, bool doNotify = false )
00255     {
00256         logger.print( "Notify: entered Matrix::getNormal", doNotify && printDebug );
00257         vector<T> ret;
00258         vector<T> tmp;
00259         T defaultValue;
00260         Utility::setDefaultValue( defaultValue );
00261         Matrix::initializePoint( ret, defaultValue, defaultValue, defaultValue );
00262         Matrix::initializePoint( tmp, defaultValue, defaultValue, defaultValue );
00263         if( p1.size() < 3 || p2.size() < 3 || p3.size() < 3 )
00264         {
00265             logger.print( "Warning: p1 size: " + lexical_cast<string>( p1.size() ) +
00266                           " p2 size: " + lexical_cast<string>( p2.size() ) + 
00267                           " p3 size: " + lexical_cast<string>( p3.size() ) +
00268                           " all sizes should be at least 3 ", printDebug );
00269              return ret;
00270         }
00271 
00272         ret[0] = p1[0] - p2[0];
00273         ret[1] = p1[1] - p2[1];
00274         ret[2] = p1[2] - p2[2];
00275 
00276         tmp[0] = p2[0] - p3[0];
00277         tmp[1] = p2[1] - p3[1];
00278         tmp[2] = p2[2] - p3[2];
00279 
00280         ret = vectorCrossProduct( ret, tmp );
00281 
00282         return ret;
00283     }

00291     template <class T>
00292     static inline vector<T> vector3MultMatrix( const vector<T>& vec3, const vector<T>& matrix, bool printDebug = true, bool doNotify = false )
00293     {
00294         if( vec3.size() != 3 )
00295         {
00296             logger.print( "Warning: the first argument: vec3 needs to be a three-dimensional vector", printDebug );
00297             return vec3;
00298         }
00299 
00300         if( matrix.size() % 3 != 0 )
00301         {
00302             logger.print( "Warning: matrix needs to be of a size that is a integer multiple of 3", printDebug );
00303 
00304             return vec3;
00305         }
00306 
00307         vector<T> result;
00308         result.resize(3);
00309         int k = 0;
00310         for( unsigned int i = 0 ; i < matrix.size(); i += 3 )
00311         {
00312             for( int j = 0; j < 3; ++j )
00313             {
00314                 logger.print( "i + j: " + lexical_cast<string>(i + j) + " matrix[i + j]: " + lexical_cast<string>( matrix[i + j] ) + " vec: " + lexical_cast<string>( vec3[j]), printDebug && doNotify );
00315 
00316                 result[k] += matrix[i + j] * vec3[j];
00317 
00318                 logger.print( "result[" + lexical_cast<string>(k) + "]" + lexical_cast<string>(k), printDebug && doNotify );
00319             }
00320 
00321             ++k;
00322         }
00323 
00324         return result;
00325     }

00327     template <class T>
00328     static inline T magnitude( vector<T> vec )
00329     {
00330         T mag;
00331         for( unsigned int i = 0; i < vec.size(); ++i )
00332         {
00333             mag += vec[i] * vec[i];
00334         }
00335         return sqrt( mag );
00336     }
